Posts.Content: Have been on Femara for about 3 years followng 18 mos on Tamoxifin.  Have  just beome stiff and have some joint pain-bearable but uncomfortable.  What do you know about the dangers  to joints etc. of continuing with this.  am 73 and have osteopenia.very mild.  Dr. has suggested i discontinue for a month  to see if pain goes away -- possibly pain is some form of arthritis,osteoporis  and aging.  Concerned about not taking the drug for fear of recurrence.  After 1 month  and  outcome might change me to arimodex or return to femara.  Comments????thanks
Posts.Title: reactions to femara

Posts.Content: On 6/9/2008 Suzie-Q wrote:     Hang in there.  I was on Tamoxifin for 2 & 1/2 years.  Ny oncologist then switched me to Aromasin because it was supposed to offer great results after taking Tamoxifin.  I had  pretty terrible bone and joint pain  from the Aromasin.  Then about six months into the Aromasin I  started with a headache  that was I was able to cope with some of the time even though it never went away.  By the 9th month the headaches were really pretty bad.  After a full year on Aromasin, my oncologist finally told me off it.  It took 8 weeks for the headache to go away.  During that 8 weeks, I didn't take any AI.  Now my doctor has started me on Femara.  I've only been on it one week with pain only in my feet and knees.  What an improvement!  My oncologist said not taking anything for the 8 weeks wouldn't hurt me.  I do trust him and am glad to be headache  and bone pain free!  My doctor says all AIs work the same way but don't always affect each woman the same way.  Work with your doctor until you find the one that causes the least side effects.  Good Luck!! thanks for your response.  all pain and stiffness have gone away and am back on femara..hope to continue until I reach 5 years with the femara-12/09. not sure what the problem was but it has subsided-think it might have been an attack of sciatica.  good luck
